question:
Consider the following linear programming problem to determine the optimum production schedule concerning three products $x_1$, $x_2$ and $x_3$ to maximize the profit regarding Company XLK Lda. The production of these products requires resources 1 and 2. 

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+5x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 45 \text{ (Resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 30 \text{ (Resource 2)}\\
& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~3\\	
\end{array}
\]	

Let $S_1$ and $S_2$ be the slack variables for the respective constraints. After we
apply the simplex method, the final incomplete simplex tableau is:

\[
\begin{array}{l|ccccc|c}
& x_{1} & x_{2} & x_{3} &  S_{1} & S_{2} & \\
\hline
x_{1} & 1 & -1/3  & 0 &  1/3 & -1/3 & 5 \\
x_{3} & 0 & 1  & 1 &  -1/5 & 2/5 & 3 \\
\hline
& &   & &   & & \\
\end{array}
\]	
Find the allowable range for the coefficient of $x_{3}$ in the objective function based on the final complete simplex tableau.

Make $r$ the subject of the expression

$p=q+r$
Find the domain of the function $f(x)= \dfrac{x^3}{\sqrt{x}}$

\[f:\mathbb{R}^{3}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}, f(x_{1},x_{2},x_{3})=x_{1}x_{2}x_{3} \]under the constraint 
\[x_{1}x_{2}+x_{1}x_{3}+x_{2}x_{3}-8=0.\]
answer1:
$f\left(  -\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3},-\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3},-\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3}\right)$ is the minimum.

 $f\left(  \frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3},\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3},\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3}\right)  \ $ is the minimum.
answer3: The fuction has no extremum points.
answer4:
$f(0,0,0)$ is the minimum.
$f(1,1,1)$ is the maximum.

answer1: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)$ does not exist

answer3: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$

question:
Construct the dual problem for the following problem:

\[\begin{array}{ll}
\text{Maximize} & Z= 2x_{1} + 7x_{2} + 4x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & x_{1} + 2x_{2} + x_{3}\leq 10\\ 
& 3x_{1}+3x_{2}+2x_{3}\leq 10\\
& x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}\geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]
answer1:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\geq 4\\
			& u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 	
			\end{array}
			\]
answer2:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\leq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\leq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\leq 4\\
			&  u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 
			\end{array}
			\]
answer3:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Maximize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} &  u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\geq 4\\
			& u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 
			\end{array}
			\]
answer4:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+u_{2}\\
	   	    \text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\geq 4\\
			&  u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 	
			\end{array}
			\]

$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 2z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
4x & + & y & - & 5z & - & 3w & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{R}^{2} \right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x &- &y &+ &z &+ &2t &= &2 \\
2x &+ &3y &+ &7z &+ &4t &= &-1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1-2z-2t,\,-1-z,\,z,\,t\right)$ as solution for every $z,t\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1-2z,\,-1-z,\,z,\,0\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(1,-1,0,0\right)$ as its unique solution.

question:

\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $(x,0,x)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $(1,0,1)$ as unique solution.
answer4: The system has $(0,y,y)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

At the HealthPlus hospital, the nursing staff works in $6$ different shifts. Each shift has a duration of $8$ hours, with its start interval of $4$ hours (the first shift starts at $8:00$ AM, the second at $12:00$ AM, the third at $4:00$ p.m., and so on). The number of nurses required during the day is as follows:

\[
\begin{array}{|l|c|}
\hline
\text{Day period} & \text{Required number of nurses} \\
\hline
\text{8:00 a.m. to 12:00 a.m.} & 140 \\
\text{12:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.} & 120 \\
\text{4:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.} & 160 \\
\text{8:00 p.m. to 12:00 p.m.} & 90 \\
\text{12:00 p.m. to 4:00 a.m.} & 30 \\
\text{4:00 a.m. to 8:00 a.m.} & 60 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]

answer1: None of the options given are correct
answer2: $x$ is the number of nurses working in each shift
answer3: $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_3$ is the number of nurses working in shift $1,~2$ and $3$, respectively
